common_issues.title: Pieces OS Account Linking and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with linking multiple accounts (Google, GitHub) and connecting to cloud services or local LLMs. Solutions include waiting for new account linking system updates, verifying internet connection, switching to smaller LLMs, and contacting support for log analysis and troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Account Linking Issue

**Key Points:**

* User johnkennyuk is experiencing issues with account linking on Pieces app.
* His Github and Google accounts are not properly merged, causing problems.
* The existing account linking system is outdated and causing issues.
* A new system is being developed and will be released in early/mid March.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not user-friendly and causing merge issues.
* Potential issue with capitalization difference in user's email addresses.
* Delay in the release of the new account linking system.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Temporary fix offered by Pieces support to merge accounts manually.
* User advised to wait for the new account linking system.
* New system should resolve merge issues and inconsistencies.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User opted to wait for the new system instead of further troubleshooting.
* New system is in development and expected to be released in early/mid March.

**Additional Notes:**

* User acknowledged the delay and expressed willingness to wait for the new system.
* Pieces support will follow up when the new system is available.

related_issues.title: Shareable link is not generating
related_issues.text:
Shareable link is not generating
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907584e3-3310-4866-bd26-5fbf6e371d62)
Shareable link is not generating . 
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* @19richa reported an issue with sharing links in Pieces.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the correct support team.
* Additional resources for similar issues and documentation were provided.
* @mark-at-pieces requested the user's email address to investigate further.
* @19richa reported that the issue was resolved.

**Problems:**

* @19richa was unable to share links in Pieces.

**Solutions:**

* No specific solution was implemented as the user reported the issue as resolved.

**Current Status:**

* Issue is closed.

**Outcome:**

* User is able to share links in Pieces.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) encountered issues with PiecesOS, experiencing problems with both cloud and local LLM requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Difficulty making requests to the cloud services.
    * Error message: "'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...'"
* **Local LLM:**
    * Difficulty using local models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Mark (@mark-at-pieces) investigated logs and identified the usage of a personal OpenApi key.
    * The personal OpenApi key was removed.
* **Local LLM:**
    * After reviewing logs, Mark suggested a call to delve deeper into the issue.
    * Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th.
    * The issue was likely due to hardware constraints and was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Issue resolved by removing the personal OpenApi key.
* **Local LLM:**
    * Issue likely resolved by using a smaller local LLM.
    * Further investigation is planned for the call on February 25th.

**Additional Notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for analysis.
* Mark accessed the log files after Rohan granted permission.

**Overall, the issue appears to be resolved for the cloud LLM and potentially resolved for the local LLM. Further investigation is planned for the local LLM.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers launch issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers failing to launch or crashing. Problems include cloud service connectivity issues, local LLM errors, and non-dismissable overlay messages. Proposed solutions involve checking internet connection, switching networks, using smaller LLMs, and adjusting startup settings.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* MR-AAYU is facing the issue "PiecesOS was unable to launch." 
* The problem persists even after providing log files.

**Key points raised:**

* MR-AAYU provided log files from the following locations:
    * c://Users/{USER}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/support/logs
    * c://Users/{USER}Documents/com.pieces.pfd/production/logs
* MR-AAYU also provided a log file from the location "C:\Users\AYUSH-ANAND\Documents\com.pieces.pfd\production".
* MR-AAYU is unable to use Pieces.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* nathan-courtney-pieces suggested checking the "C:\Users\AYUSH-ANAND\OneDrive\Documents" folder for a folder named "com.pieces.os" and deleting it if found.
* nathan-courtney-pieces also suggested booking a time on their calendar for further diagnosis if the problem persists.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* Further investigation and diagnosis are required.

**Additional notes:**

* MR-AAYU is using Pieces for Developers and has two installations.
* OneDrive may be preventing Pieces OS from launching properly.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing a problem with Pieces for VS Code crashing after 10 minutes.
* The crash is accompanied by a non-dismissable overlay message stating that PiecesOS is not running.
* The problem seems to occur when VS Code is launched.
* Restarting the computer is the only way to remove the overlay message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces for VS Code is crashing unexpectedly.
* The crash is preventing ThemePark from using Pieces effectively.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Mack-at-pieces** suggested that the problem might be caused by a timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop App. 
* **ThemePark** confirmed that PiecesOS is the only app configured to launch on Startup.
* **Mack-at-pieces** recommended switching the Startup App to the Pieces Desktop App or not launching either app at Startup.
* **ThemePark** opted to keep PiecesOS as the Startup App.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* ThemePark is still experiencing the problem every day, which is impacting their workflow.
* ThemePark has provided additional details about the crash and is continuing to investigate the issue.

**Outstanding Questions:**

* Has ThemePark tried switching the Startup App to the Pieces Desktop App or not launching either app at Startup?
* Is there any way to prevent the timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop App?

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be specific to Pieces for VS Code.
* The non-dismissable overlay message appears to be a new development.

I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any questions.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama, resulting in Cuda dll errors and installation problems. This is often caused by startup order conflicts or incompatible versions. Solutions include reinstalling Ollama, managing startup sequences, and ensuring compatibility between Pieces OS and the chosen Ollama model.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Johnkennyuk encountered Cuda12 dll errors with Ollama Server on Pieces OS.
* The errors occurred due to startup order conflicts between Ollama App and Pieces OS.
* The user attempted multiple reinstalls and path cleanups before the issue self-resolved.

**Problems identified:**

* Conflicting DLL versions between Pieces OS's Ollama and the user-installed version.
* Race condition where Ollama App launched before the Ollama server started, leading to errors.
* Uncertainty regarding Pieces OS detecting and managing external Ollama App instances.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User performed multiple reinstallations and cleanups.
* Pieces OS pushed a change in version 11.1.2 to potentially fix the race condition.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User continues to experience the race condition, even with the update.
* further troubleshooting and communication is required to resolve the issue. 

**Additional details:**

* The user reports using Winget for installation and uninstallation.
* The specific DLL error encountered is cublas64_12.dll.

**Overall, the conversation highlights the importance of consistent software installation and startup management. Further investigation is needed to address the ongoing race condition issue and improve the user's experience.**

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User `waseem852` is experiencing issues with Ollama not working within Pieces.
* They have tried installing Ollama through various methods (Pieces setup, manually, winget), but the issue persists.
* The user has restarted Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop and also uninstalled and reinstalled Ollama multiple times.

**Problems identified:**

* Ollama fails to install or function properly within the Pieces environment.
* The problem persists regardless of the installation method used.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Restart both Pieces apps after uninstalling Ollama.
* Shut down both apps completely through Task Manager.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user and `brian-at-pieces` agreed to schedule a call to debug the issue further.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS/PFD Launch and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers failing to launch or connect to cloud/local LLMs. Issues include invalid port errors, cloud service connectivity problems, and dependency errors. Solutions involve checking logs, verifying internet connection, switching to smaller LLMs, and ensuring PiecesOS is not blocked by OneDrive.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* Mariusz Kowalski reported an issue with the Pieces Desktop App on Linux.
* The issue seems related to previous reports involving certain Linux machines.
* Mark and Mack at Pieces are investigating the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Desktop App is experiencing issues on some Linux machines.
* The exact cause of the issue is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack requested the log file from Mariusz.
* Mack offered a video call to troubleshoot the issue live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Mariusz provided the log file.
* Mariusz is unable to join a live session.
* The investigation is ongoing.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided information is limited.
* More details are needed to fully understand the issue and its resolution.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) encountered issues with PiecesOS, experiencing problems with both cloud and local LLM requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Difficulty making requests to the cloud services.
    * Error message: "'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...'"
* **Local LLM:**
    * Difficulty using local models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Mark (@mark-at-pieces) investigated logs and identified the usage of a personal OpenApi key.
    * The personal OpenApi key was removed.
* **Local LLM:**
    * After reviewing logs, Mark suggested a call to delve deeper into the issue.
    * Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th.
    * The issue was likely due to hardware constraints and was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Issue resolved by removing the personal OpenApi key.
* **Local LLM:**
    * Issue likely resolved by using a smaller local LLM.
    * Further investigation is planned for the call on February 25th.

**Additional Notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for analysis.
* Mark accessed the log files after Rohan granted permission.

**Overall, the issue appears to be resolved for the cloud LLM and potentially resolved for the local LLM. Further investigation is planned for the local LLM.**

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* MR-AAYU is facing the issue "PiecesOS was unable to launch." 
* The problem persists even after providing log files.

**Key points raised:**

* MR-AAYU provided log files from the following locations:
    * c://Users/{USER}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/support/logs
    * c://Users/{USER}Documents/com.pieces.pfd/production/logs
* MR-AAYU also provided a log file from the location "C:\Users\AYUSH-ANAND\Documents\com.pieces.pfd\production".
* MR-AAYU is unable to use Pieces.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* nathan-courtney-pieces suggested checking the "C:\Users\AYUSH-ANAND\OneDrive\Documents" folder for a folder named "com.pieces.os" and deleting it if found.
* nathan-courtney-pieces also suggested booking a time on their calendar for further diagnosis if the problem persists.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* Further investigation and diagnosis are required.

**Additional notes:**

* MR-AAYU is using Pieces for Developers and has two installations.
* OneDrive may be preventing Pieces OS from launching properly.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS crashes or malfunctions with LTM
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS crashing, restarting, or failing to process requests when Long Term Memory (LTM) is enabled. This issue appears across different PiecesOS versions and might stem from conflicts with LTM's interaction with system resources, cloud services, or local LLMs. Proposed solutions involve disabling LTM, checking network connectivity, switching to smaller LLMs, or ensuring PiecesOS launches correctly on startup.

related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I enable Long term memory engine on and use it on pieces for dev or vscode when I try to prompt anything, piecesOS shit's off and starts looping on restart until I manage in the seconds it stays on to disable the LTM engine.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** [LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/606)

**Key Points:**

* User reports LTM cannot see code inside a sandbox environment in the browser.
* This issue is similar to previously reported issues on Linux Mint 22.1 and non-dismissable overlay messages.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM functionality is limited in sandbox environments.
* This potentially hinders user experience and development workflow.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User is directed to potentially relevant existing issues and documentation for troubleshooting.
* No specific solution is proposed or implemented within the conversation excerpt.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and routed to the appropriate team.
* A follow-up within 24 hours is expected.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided conversation excerpt is limited and may not represent the full scope of the issue and its resolution. 
* It is recommended to refer to the original GitHub issue for further details and updates.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing a problem with Pieces for VS Code crashing after 10 minutes.
* The crash is accompanied by a non-dismissable overlay message stating that PiecesOS is not running.
* The problem seems to occur when VS Code is launched.
* Restarting the computer is the only way to remove the overlay message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces for VS Code is crashing unexpectedly.
* The crash is preventing ThemePark from using Pieces effectively.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Mack-at-pieces** suggested that the problem might be caused by a timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop App. 
* **ThemePark** confirmed that PiecesOS is the only app configured to launch on Startup.
* **Mack-at-pieces** recommended switching the Startup App to the Pieces Desktop App or not launching either app at Startup.
* **ThemePark** opted to keep PiecesOS as the Startup App.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* ThemePark is still experiencing the problem every day, which is impacting their workflow.
* ThemePark has provided additional details about the crash and is continuing to investigate the issue.

**Outstanding Questions:**

* Has ThemePark tried switching the Startup App to the Pieces Desktop App or not launching either app at Startup?
* Is there any way to prevent the timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop App?

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be specific to Pieces for VS Code.
* The non-dismissable overlay message appears to be a new development.

I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any questions.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi (@rohanrathi99) encountered issues with PiecesOS, experiencing problems with both cloud and local LLM requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Difficulty making requests to the cloud services.
    * Error message: "'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...'"
* **Local LLM:**
    * Difficulty using local models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Mark (@mark-at-pieces) investigated logs and identified the usage of a personal OpenApi key.
    * The personal OpenApi key was removed.
* **Local LLM:**
    * After reviewing logs, Mark suggested a call to delve deeper into the issue.
    * Rohan scheduled a meeting for February 25th.
    * The issue was likely due to hardware constraints and was resolved by using a smaller local LLM.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Cloud LLM:**
    * Issue resolved by removing the personal OpenApi key.
* **Local LLM:**
    * Issue likely resolved by using a smaller local LLM.
    * Further investigation is planned for the call on February 25th.

**Additional Notes:**

* Rohan provided log files for analysis.
* Mark accessed the log files after Rohan granted permission.

**Overall, the issue appears to be resolved for the cloud LLM and potentially resolved for the local LLM. Further investigation is planned for the local LLM.**

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS and Ollama integration issues:** This recurring problem causes launch failures and errors, significantly impacting user experience. Focus on ensuring compatibility and resolving conflicts between Pieces OS, Ollama, and CUDA.

**Investigate and address PiecesOS/PFD launch and connection issues:** Users face difficulties launching Pieces for Developers and connecting to cloud/local LLMs. Analyze logs, identify the root causes of invalid port errors, cloud service connectivity problems, and dependency errors, and implement necessary fixes.

**Improve account linking functionality:** Users experience persistent problems with linking multiple accounts, hindering their ability to leverage cloud services. Expedite the development and rollout of the new account linking system to address these issues.

**Address PiecesOS crashes and malfunctions related to Long Term Memory (LTM):** Investigate why PiecesOS crashes or restarts when LTM is enabled. Determine if conflicts exist between LTM and system resources, cloud services, or local LLMs, and provide solutions or workarounds.

**Provide clear guidance on startup settings and configurations:** Offer users detailed instructions on configuring Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers, including startup options, network settings, and LLM selection, to prevent conflicts and ensure smooth operation.

**Enhance communication and transparency:** Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution timelines. Proactively communicate workarounds or temporary solutions while addressing underlying problems.

**Gather more detailed logs and system information:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system details when reporting issues. This will help support teams diagnose problems more effectively and expedite resolutions.

**Develop a comprehensive troubleshooting guide:** Create a centralized resource with detailed troubleshooting steps for common issues related to launch failures, connection problems, account linking, and LTM. This will empower users to resolve problems independently and reduce support requests.

**Consider hardware constraints:** Some users experience issues due to limited hardware resources. Provide recommendations on minimum system requirements and offer guidance on selecting appropriate LLMs based on available hardware.
**Improve error messages and guidance:** Make error messages more informative and user-friendly. Provide clear explanations of the problem and suggest actionable steps for resolution.
